label: Avoid_weight_gain
text: Watch out for added calories in recipes. When possible use yogurt or low-fat sour cream instead of margarine or butter. Be a detective ÔøΩÔøΩWithout the stretchy and sticky qualities of gluten gluten-free recipes must use other means to hold starch-based products together. It means a serving size of traditional packaged cookies might be two whereas with a gluten-free product it would be on Watch serving sizes Avoid meals with only one food group. For example add nuts and seeds to gluten-free cereal. Plan variety in individual meals ÔøΩÔøΩFiber helps people feel fuller longer and since many gluten-free products are low in fiber they may not be fully satisfying. Eating more fruits and vegetables can help keep hunger at ba Increase fiber intake Use Gluten-free products when possible. Choose low-fat ÔøΩÔøΩEat popcorn instead of gluten-free fried chips. Make homemade trail mix with gluten-free granola dried fruits nuts and seeds instead of munching on gluten-free pretzel Snack wisely Select lean meats fish and chicken for protein sources. Go lean Anyone who consumes too much of any high-calorie item such as pasta will gain weight whether it‚Äôs gluten-free or regular. Eat a varied diet How to Avoid Weight Gain with Celiac Disease

label: Food_to_eat
text: Wine:one glass of red wine Sweeteners:Natural stevia and chocolate (choose dark chocolate that‚Äôs at least 70 percent or more cocoa). Cottage cheese yogurt and kefir:use sparingly in recipes or as a topping. ÔøΩCow‚Äôs milk and cream:use sparingly coffee and tea because people who are gluten intolerant are often lactose intolerant too ÔøΩÔøΩWhole sweet fruit:Berries are best; be extra cautious of sugary fruits such as apricots mangos melons papaya prunes and pineapple Legumes:Exception: you can have hummus (made from chickpeas). ÔøΩVNon-gluten grains:Amaranth buckwheat rice (brown white wild) millet quinoa so ÔøΩÔøΩThe following can be used in moderation means eating small amounts of these ingredients once a day or just a couple times weekl ÔøΩ8Patients who have celiac disease have an increased ris Vitamin K rich foods Avocado bell peppers cucumber tomato zucchini squash pumpkin eggplant lemons limes. Vitamin B rich foods Iron rich foods like meat fish chicken beans nuts seeds eggs and amaranth. label: Activity2
text: ‚Ä¢ Tingling numbness in hands and feet. ‚Ä¢ Bone loss or osteoporosis. ‚Ä¢ Depression or anxiety. ‚Ä¢ Bone or joint pain. ‚Ä¢ Iron deficiency. Common symptoms for adults include: Symptoms for Adults ‚Ä¢ Pregnancy. ‚Ä¢ Suffering an injury or illness. ‚Ä¢ Leaving home for college. For teens with celiac disease symptoms may not occur until they are triggered by something stressful such as: Symptoms for teenagers ‚Ä¢ Fatigue. ‚Ä¢ Abdominal bloating and pain. ‚Ä¢ Chronic diarrhea which can be bloody. ‚Ä¢ Decreased appetite and failure to gain weight. ‚Ä¢ Growth problems. Infants and children with celiac disease tend to have digestive problems. Common symptoms for infants and children include: Symptoms for Children ÔøΩÔøΩCeliac disease has numerous symptoms. Different people will experience the disease in different ways because the symptoms vary greatly from one person to the nex Symptoms of Celiac disease

The following are miscellaneous sources of gluten: ‚Ä¢ oats . ‚Ä¢ beer . ‚Ä¢ hot dogs . ‚Ä¢ ice cream . ‚Ä¢ ketchup . ‚Ä¢ cold cuts . ‚Ä¢ commercial bullion and broths . ‚Ä¢ soups . The following foods often contain gluten: ‚Ä¢ Farina. ‚Ä¢ Couscous. ‚Ä¢ Bulgur. ‚Ä¢ Barley. ‚Ä¢ Rye. ‚Ä¢ Wheat germ. ‚Ä¢ Wheat. text: High in calories they can worsen inflammation and deplete the body of nutrients. ‚Ä¢ Added sugars: ÔøΩÔøΩThese include hydrogenated and partially hydrogenated oils trans fats and refine vegetable oils that raise inflammation including corn oil soybean oil and canola oi ‚Ä¢ Processed fats: ÔøΩ It is important to read fo ‚Ä¢ Bottled condiments and sauces: ÔøΩÔøΩDue to cross-contamination during manufacturing gluten-free grains can sometimes contain small amounts of gluten. Be careful because ‚Äúwheat-free‚Äù does not necessarily mean ‚Äúglute ‚Ä¢ In some cases even gluten-free grains: These are made with barley or wheat. ‚Ä¢ Beer and malt alcohol: ÔøΩÔøΩWheat-based baking flours and products include all bran bromated flour durum flour enriched flour farina phosphate flour plain flour self-rising flour and white flou ‚Ä¢ Most baking flours: ÔøΩoThese are often made with refined wheat flour but even those that are not predominately wheat-based can have ‚Ä¢ Processed carbohydrate foods: Avoid all products that contain wheat couscous spelt semolina rye barley and even oats. ‚Ä¢ All products containing wheat barley rye: Foods that contain gluten to avoid on a celiac disease diet include: ÔøΩÔøΩThe single most important thing to do on a celiac disease diet is avoid all products containing wheat barley or rye. Gluten makes up about 80 percent of the protein found in these three grain Food to Avoid

label: Ways_to_gain_weight
text: Exercise is essential. ‚ÄúExercise goes hand-in-hand with a healthy balanced diet in order to maintain a healthy weight. Exercise ÔøΩÔøΩYou can definitely put on weight by drinking whole fat milk in volumes. It is full of high protein and calories required for building muscle. It is very simple method to put on weight easil Drink More Milk if Not Lactose Intolerant ÔøΩÔøΩDue to malabsorption and maldigestion issues that often accompany celiac disease eating enough fat is important for both weight gai Fat Sources ÔøΩrOne of the most challenging macronutrients to supplement your diet with when suffering from celiac disease is ca Carbohydrate Sources ÔøΩÔøΩThere‚Äôs no magic to this but if you are trying to get in extra calories it‚Äôs often easier to split them up over the day rather than stuffing yourself at Eat every few hours ÔøΩ$Increase the amount of alternative Eat More Calories Ways to Gain Weight with Celiac Disease

label: Activity4
text: Sources include most (but not all) wines or hard liquors. ‚Ä¢ Gluten-free alcohol: Great source of collagen glucosamine and amino acids that help repair the GI tract. ‚Ä¢ Bone broth: ÔøΩÔøΩThese include all beans wild or brown rice gluten-free oats buckwheat quinoa teff and amaranth. It is a good idea to properly prepare beans and grains (especially types that contain gluten) by soaking sprouting and fermenting the ‚Ä¢ Legumes beans and gluten-free whole grains: ÔøΩÔøΩGood source of electrolytes like calcium and potassium healthy fats and protein sources include goat milk or yogurt other fermented yogurts goat or sheep cheese and raw milk from A2 cow ‚Ä¢ Dairy (organic and raw is best): ÔøΩÔøΩGood sources of healthy fats fiber omega-3 fats and minerals almonds walnuts flaxseeds hemp chia seeds pumpkin sesame and sunflower are all good option ‚Ä¢ Nuts and seeds: Sources include ghee or butter avocado virgin coconut grape seed virgin olive flaxseed avocado hemp and pumpkin oils. ‚Ä¢ Healthy fats: ÔøΩÔøΩThese provide protein omega-3 fats and minerals that fight malnutrition and inflammation. Sources include cage-free eggs fish (wild-caught) pasture-raised poultry grass-fed beef organ meats and other protein foods and omega-3 food ‚Ä¢ Lean proteins: ÔøΩÔøΩFruits and vegetables are the cornerstone of any healthy diet and are naturally gluten-free. They provide valuable essential nutrients fiber and antioxidants to raise immune functio ‚Ä¢ Fruits and vegetables: ÔøΩÔøΩThe best way to manage celiac disease symptoms and prevent future health problems is to follow a strict gluten-free diet along with improving overall immune function through preventing nutrient deficiencies reducing stress and getting enough slee ÔøΩÔøΩCeliac disease is a type of serious food allergy. A celiac disease diet meaning one that is strictly gluten-free and high in bioavailable nutrients helps manage symptoms reb Foods for the Celiac Disease Diet Food to eat

label: Food_to_avoid
text: ÔøΩcCeliac disease does make beer drinking impossible unless options that are gluten free are used i Beer ÔøΩÔøΩCoffee is something that celiac sufferers should avoid for numerous reasons but mainly due to its possibly cross reactive effects in sufferers. Coffee contains a protein that gluten antibodies react to which Coffee ÔøΩ9There are numerous reasons that salad dressings and sau Dressings and Sauces ÔøΩkOver processed ingestibles are foods to avoid with celiac disease because their digestion is difficult ev Over Processed and Refined Foods ÔøΩMiso is a fermente Miso ÔøΩÔøΩPotatoes are a starchy part of many healthy diets but they alongside other members of the nightshade family tree can cause Potatoes ÔøΩÔøΩFlour water and eggs are the three main ingredients in pasta. Pasta made with semolina whole wheat and unbleached flour must be avoided. Noodles made from the flour of finely ground rice do not contain glute Pasta ÔøΩÔøΩThe sweetened candy bar base contains two foods to avoid with celiac disease sugar and dairy that can make existing symptoms worse or bring about new ones. Many people Milk Chocolate ÔøΩoIt may seem odd that lunchtime proteins are considered foods to avoid with celiac disease. However this is n Lunch Meat ÔøΩÔøΩCouscous is made from semolina flour. Semolina is the hard part of a grain of hard wheat. The endosperm or center of the grain of wheat contains gluten. Barley can be used to make some varieties of couscous. This tiny pasta must be avoide Couscous ÔøΩ A food to Wheat ÔøΩÔøΩCroutons are cubes of stale bread that have been buttered baked and seasoned. They are a familiar salad topping that must be avoided if you have celiac diseas Croutons ÔøΩÔøΩThere are some variants of the favorite side dishes that are gluten free. However regular potato chips and fries are not celiac disease friendly and can lead to symptoms when the gluten is consume French Fries and Potato Chips ÔøΩ Because Oats ÔøΩÔøΩCeliac disease is a genetic digestive disease that causes damage to the small intestine and interferes with the absorption of nu Foods to Avoid Pro Features

label: Activity3
text: ÔøΩÔøΩNegative testing meanwhile does not mean you definitely do not have a problem with gluten. You can test negative on celiac blood tests and biopsy and still suffer from problems related to gluten ingestio ÔøΩÔøΩPositive test results for celiac disease on your endoscopy and biopsy means you definitely have the condition and must follow the gluten-free diet for lif Celiac Disease Diagnossis Means Gluten-Free Diet ÔøΩÔøΩHowever to confirm the diagnosis the surgeon also will use the instrument to take tiny samples of your intestine. Because damage from celiac disease can be patchy the surgeon should take at least four to six sample Process in Intestinal Biopsy ÔøΩ2In an endoscopy an instrument with a tiny camer Process in Endoscopy ÔøΩ9If your celiac disease blood tests come back positive o Next Step: Endoscopy and Intestinal Biopsy ÔøΩÔøΩThe celiac disease blood tests look for antibodies that show your immune systems response to the gluten in your diet-‚Äìthat is why you need to be eating gluten when you are tested for celiac dise First Step in Celiac Disease diagnosis: Blood Tests ÔøΩ7If you are not eating gluten-containing foods or not ÔøΩ2Celiac disease is a condition that involves your How to diagnose Celiac disease

Untreated patients with celiac disease often are lactose intolerant. With successful treatment dairy products can often be reintroduced slowly into the diet late ‚Ä¢ Avoid products that contain lactose ‚Ä¢ Yogurt ‚Ä¢ Ketchup and mustard ‚Ä¢ Luncheon meats and processed or canned meats ‚Ä¢ Instant coffee ‚Ä¢ Candy bars ‚Ä¢ Ice cream ‚Ä¢ Salad dressings ‚Ä¢ Canned soups Pay attention to processed foods that may contain gluten. Examples are breads cereals pasta crackers cakes pies cookies and gravie ‚Ä¢ Avoid food made from wheat rye and barley The standard treatment calls for complete avoidance of gluten for life. label: DisplayActivity
text: * Include more of high fiber food as in Multigrain Atta whole grains cereal and pulses e.g. kidney beans black grams chickpea etc.* Use toned milk and its products.* Include leafy vegetables carrots cucumber beetroot broccoli bitter gourd pumpkin tomatoes in your diet.* Include more of high fiber fruits like apples orange guava watermelon Muskmelon papaya etc and lower the intake of banana mango Sapodilla grapes etc.* Avoid all kind of packaged and canned drinks and foods.* Use healthy cooking methods like boiling stewing baking and grilling instead of deep frying.* Make use of MUFA and PUFA rich oils and avoid hydrogenated fats and Trans Fats.* Include almonds walnuts and Flax seeds in your diet.* Low salt and low sugar.* Drink plenty of water.* Do 30-45 minutes exercise or yoga or brisk walk daily.
